N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7002.3 - Identification

State Regulations
(a) Consistent with
the requirements of this section, identification procedures, including
fingerprinting, shall be established for prisoners confined in local
correctional facilities. (b) All
prisoner fingerprints shall be taken in accordance with the rules and methods
prescribed by the Division of Criminal Justice Services. If the prisoner is
sentenced for a felony or a misdemeanor, two copies of the prisoner's
fingerprints shall be forwarded by the facility to the Division of Criminal

Justice Services within 24 hours of the admission of such sentenced prisoner to
the facility. One copy of such fingerprints shall be retained by the
facility. (c) When deemed necessary
to maintain the safety and security of the facility, the chief administrative
officer may: (1)
take the fingerprints of
unsentenced prisoners; or
(2)
take
palmprints or a photograph of any prisoner. Notes
